ygData.subject: Re: Skill training while you sleep.
ygData.msgSnippet: You could get those little motorized legos and try to build a button pusher.  Its not hard, and I ve seen it done before.  Don t know how it d work though.
ygData.messageBody:
You could get those little motorized legos and try to build a button
pusher. Its not hard, and I've seen it done before. Don't know how it'd
work though. And you know those little strange bird things, that dip their
beak repeatedly, depending on room temperature? This is just idle
speculation... but if you could position it to hit your 1 key......

--
Darkblade, player of Asherons Call, doesn't know why hes still subscribed to
this list (Sentimentality)

----- Original Message -----
From: James <wsjames@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, February 20, 2000 11:30 PM
Subject: [EQ-Monks] Skill training while you sleep.


> From: "James" <wsjames@...>
>
> Lately Ive been trying to think of a way to train hard-to-learn skills
> while Im sleeping - such as instill doubt. I know you can target a corpse
> and train ID. I have set up my sidewinder precision pro, using its
profiler
> software, to press #s 1-6 (the skill hotkeys) by just pressing 1 button on
> the joystick. Thing is, I can't figure out any way to get this button to
be
> pressed down over and over (if you hold it down with a rubberband or
> similar, it will work once, but wont keep pressing your hotkeys all
night).
> Sidewinder doesnt seem to have auto-fire. I know that gravis makes a
> joystick (or is it gamepad?) with autofire but I'd rather not spend a ton
of
> money - I already pay 8 bucks a month for this game =P
> Has anyone put some thought into this? Anyone ever created a
> button-presser? Let me know what you folks think - I'd rather not spend
my
> waking hours pressing hotkeys =)
>
> Kyeric
